intro: Allantodia yaoshanica, commonly known as the Yaoshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and rarity, Allantodia yaoshanica is considered a species of conservation concern.
